ankur_kotwal.bio: Ankur is a developer advocate on the Google Cloud developer relations team, where he champions the developer experience on the Google Cloud Platform. Previously, Ankur lead the Google Maps developer relations team where he helped launch the Google Maps APIs gaming offering. Ankur has also been the product manager and software engineer for Google Santa Tracker on Android, an annual tradition focusing on bringing holiday joy through fun and games.

ankur_kotwal.title: Developer Advocate - Google Cloud Platform

azadeh_khojandi.title: Tech evangelist
azadeh_khojandi.bio: Microsoft Software engineer and Sitecore MVP 2017 with more than 10 years experience across a range of diverse and exciting web and mobile solutions. Az is co-organiser of girls geek Sydney and SheHacks. Az has worked with clients including Vodafone, KFC Australia, Sydney Airport, Lend Lease, Sydney Olympic Park. Az is a member of Asia’s Machine learning tech domain at Microsoft. She is TechLead/ full stack developer and she can code in C#, JavaScript, Typescript and Python. she is familiar with Keras, TensorFlow and Pytorch. Az has presented in few local and international tech conferences about Chatbots, AI and Machine learning.

brett_morgan.bio: Brett is a developer relations engineer with Google Sydney, where he works on Google Maps APIs by day, and plays happily with Flutter by night. Brett has done everything from system administration of 25,000 user Solaris machines to designing e-commerce solutions for large Australian industrial suppliers.

dan_aschwanden.shortBio: Dan Aschwanden is a Cloud Consultant in Infrastructure and App Development within the Professional Services Organisation of Google Australia. In this role he helps customers to accelerate their journey to the cloud. Dan has over 15 years experience helping organisations across a wide range of industries including Telecommunications, Transportation, Financial Services and Healthcare solving their strategic challenges with building large scale systems.

dan_aschwanden.title: Cloud Consultant

elizabeth_wu.shortBio: Elizabeth Wu is a Cloud Consultant in Big Data and Analytics within the Professional Services Organisaton of Google Australia. In this role she helps customers to accelerate their journey to the cloud. Elizabeth has over 10 years experience helping organisations across a wide range of industries including Government, Education, Financial Services, Utilities and Healthcare solve their strategic challenges by making their data accessible and useful.

elizabeth_wu.title: Cloud Consultant

georgie_luhur_cooke.bio: Georgie is a user interface engineer at Campaign Monitor and also co-organises the codebar Sydney meetup. She cares deeply about accessibility and semantic code, and is always keen to learn. She really enjoys blogging and writing about many topics, and is extremely passionate about bringing up other women in tech. She loves expressing herself through fashion, and embraces a minimalist lifestyle. In her spare time she is probably at the gym, enjoying nature, or blogging.

georgina_robilliard.title: Head of People and Culture
georgina_robilliard.bio: Georgina builds happy and productive work environments. Formerly of Lookahead Search, currently Head of People and Culture at Insured By Us. Cheese, wine and sausage dog enthusiast.

graham_polley.name: Graham Polley
graham_polley.title: Software engineer
graham_polley.bio: Graham is a software engineer based out of Melbourne Australia. He's passionate about advocating for the adoption of cloud to build software solutions. An active member in the local community, he regularly blogs, gives presentations, and is a co-organiser of the Melbourne GCP user group. Graham has extensive experience in building data solutions for clients using GCP - in particular with BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow and Cloud Dataproc. He works very closely with the GCP engineering teams, where he's also a member of their cloud platform trusted tester program, and the solutions he helps build are used as internal exemplars of developer use cases.

badges.name: gde
badges.description: Google Cloud Platform Google Developer Expert

kai_koenig.bio: Kai works as a Software Solutions Architect for Ventego Creative in Wellington, New Zealand. He co-founded the company with two partners and is also the CTO of Zen Ex Machina, a startup in the fields of digital & user experience consultancy based out of Canberra in Australia. Kai's work comprises a mix of consulting, training, mentoring and actual development work using a range of technologies, common themes being Java, Android, Kotlin, CFML, JavaScript and others. Other stuff Kai occasionally does: Writes for magazines, produces a Podcast (2 Developers Down Under) with his friend Mark Mandel from Melbourne/San Francisco and since 2007 flies small, single- and twin-engine airplanes around New Zealand and sometimes Australia.

kai_koenig.title: Owner and principal software solutions architect

sergii_kozyrev.shortBio: Senior Android Engineer at Atlassian. Currently working in Mobile Core team ensuring our customers are getting best libraries and tools to solve their business needs. I use Java and Python and passionate about mobile development, ubiquitous computing, machine learning, augmented and virtual reality. I love the way technology can bring magic into our lives and love to share my thoughts on this with others :)

sergii_kozyrev.title: Senior software engineer

shan_ul_haq.shortBio: Shan is a Technical Lead at Tigerspike, a software development company, working on enterprise and consumer mobile applications. Perfection is his mantra in everything be it writing code or designing an architecture or something else. If he is not writing code for a project, he is busy automating the toolings and process for the development teams to keep engineers happy and make their life easier. Shan is a foodie and always in the hunt for delicious food. In his spare time, he can be found playing with his kids in a playground or hunting for some good food.
